topic.title: klaus - easy-to-set-up Git web viewer in Python
FreeBSD - the server OS
brave - browse faster and safer with annoying ads and trackers
Opera Mini - Data-saving mobile browser with ad blocker and offline pages
Chromium - open source extensible browser (warn: you need a lot of RAM)
Terminology - terminal emulator in lightweight EFL (X11, Wayland, framebuffer)
Bitmessage - P2P (using blockchain) alternative for email
amule - cross platform ed2k/Kademlia client
tmux - a modern terminal multiplexer
fish - a smart and user-friendly (but heavy) shell
BusyBox - combines tiny versions of common UNIX utilities into a single small executable
git - a distributed version control system for source code with stupid UI
dropbear - lightweight alternative to openssh
aria2 - lightweight multi-protocol & multi-source command-line download utility
rime - modular, extensible, cross-platform input method engine in  C++
musl - ightweight, fast, simple, free libc
gpg - encrypt and sign your data and communication
Void - a rolling release Linux distribution with runit, LibreSSL, and (optional) musl
F-Droid - an catalog/market of FOSS applications for Android
borg - deduplicating backup program with rolling checksum, compression and encryption
w3m - a text-based web browser (html only)
TeXmacs - wysiwyw LaTeX alternative
entr - Run arbitrary commands when files change on BSD and Linux
csgp - a port of supergenpass.com in plain c
ipfs - peer-to-peer hypermedia protocol
IntelliJ IDEA - Intelligent IDE for Java and other languages
SimpleNote - cross platform note taking with plain text & markdown

1_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR.body:
Features:

- no configuration required
- Python 2 and Python 3
- syntax highlighting
- Git Smart HTTP support
- code navigation using Exuberant ctags
- markup (markdown & ReStructuredText) rendering

2_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR.body:
Besides server, it is also a good desktop OS if:

0. You are tired of systemd propagating into most mainstream Linux distributions.
1. Your hardware is not new.
2. You do not use any Linux specific applications.

3_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR.body:
Available for desktops (Windows 7+, macOS, Linux) and mobiles (iOS, Android).
I use it on iOS & Android.

14_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR.body:
It supports HTTP/HTTPS, FTP, SFTP, BitTorrent and Metalink.
It has built-in JSON-RPC and XML-RPC interfaces.

1_171fhZp8nPaJTLfTnov3hSQE8pweTcf6wC.body: It's a tiny OS offering a LISP like shell within browser.

1_12yaKkoqVKBUi66uB5pYXamWguKFaWdDnx.body: There is an open source alternative [syncthing](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing). However, if you want to sync with iOS devices or publicly with lots of people, BTSync is the only choice.

1_19SbSoytV8aD6GtpJi9F6RDSnGzunYgYzo.body:
Dat deduplicats data between versions.

Dat nodes discovery each other via DNS(including mDNS) and DHT.

23_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR.body: entr works on BSD, Mac OS, and Linux. It is an alternative to inotifywait, which only works on Linux.
